content:
That's great to hear that you're excited about dancing! Congratulations on signing up for the contemporary dance class, and I'm happy to help you with some playlist ideas for your work dance club.

Since you've recently taken a contemporary dance class, I'll suggest a mix of genres and tempos to get you and your coworkers moving. Here are some ideas to get you started:

**Warm-up/Stretching Section (10-15 minutes)**

1. Norah Jones - Come Away With Me (mellow, jazzy vibe)
2. The Weeknd - Earned It (soulful, slow jam)
3. Adele - Hello (emotional, contemporary-inspired)

**Upbeat Section (20-25 minutes)**

1. Justin Timberlake - Can't Stop the Feeling! (fun, upbeat pop)
2. Ariana Grande - No Tears Left to Cry (empowering, dance-pop)
3. Bruno Mars - Uptown Funk (funky, energetic)
4. Katy Perry - Roar (inspirational, pop-rock)
5. Justin Bieber - Sorry (catchy, dance-pop)

**Throwback Section (15-20 minutes)**

1. Michael Jackson - Don't Stop 'Til You Get Enough (classic, funky)
2. Prince - Kiss (iconic, funky rock)
3. Whitney Houston - I Wanna Dance with Somebody (upbeat, pop classic)
4. Spice Girls - Wannabe (90s pop, fun)
5. NSYNC - Bye Bye Bye (90s pop, high-energy)

**Contemporary/Chillout Section (10-15 minutes)**

1. Lorde - Royals (moody, indie-pop)
2. Halsey - Eastside (mellow, electro-pop)
3. Billie Eilish - bad guy (dark, contemporary-inspired)
4. Lana Del Rey - Summertime Sadness (dreamy, atmospheric)
5. Florence + The Machine - Dog Days Are Over (indie-pop, uplifting)

**Cool-down Section (5-10 minutes)**

1. Sam Smith - Too Good at Goodbyes (emotional, soulful)
2. Ed Sheeran - Thinking Out Loud (romantic, acoustic)
3. John Legend - All of Me (heartfelt, piano ballad)

Feel free to add or remove songs based on your personal taste and the preferences of your coworkers. You can also consider including some popular dance tracks from genres like hip-hop, electronic, or Latin music to cater to diverse tastes.

Remember to keep the playlist engaging and varied to keep your coworkers motivated and excited throughout the dance club sessions. Good luck, and have fun!
